Gentleman, why not put in a fake bid for $20.000 and let the auction
end. That way you will find out who the fraudster is when he sends you
his bank info for payment. (he will not have registered with ebay unders
his real name) Then report him to ebay and the local authorities in
Thailand ! I did this to some dude in Indonesia a while back with one of
Alf Tan's swords, then sent Alf the info on the dude. I think he must be
in some serious trouble now......................
 
- Matt

-----Oorspronkelijk bericht-----
Van: samurai@... [mailto:samurai@...] 
Verzonden: donderdag 31 juli 2003 2:17
Aan: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
CC: condell@...
Onderwerp: Re: [nihontostudy] EBAY FRAUD



Start here:

http://pages.ebay.com/help/index_popup.html?policies=replica-counterfeit
.html

Go to the "Report" link at the bottom of the page.

Only the current "owner" can report it (if this is in the sold gallery,
you may be out of luck unless you want to fudge it a bit). 

The above link is worthwhile to be on people's bookmarks. I often use it
to report fake swords, though that apparently does no good.

Going through there usually gets the sale removed in 24 hours.

You cannot email ebay staff.

- darcy

<condell@...> writes:
